factoid: Rostóv was with a platoon on skirmishing duty in front of Bagratión’s detachment.
Rostóv's hussars were placed along the line in couples.
Rostóv rode along the line trying to master the sleepiness that kept coming over him.
An enormous space with Rostóv's army’s campfires dimly glowing in the fog could be seen behind Rostóv.
In front of Rostóv was misty darkness.
Rostóv could see nothing in front of him.
Rostóv peered into the foggy distance.
Something gleamed gray in the distance.
Something black was in the distance.
Little lights seemed to glimmer where the enemy ought to be.
Rostóv fancied that what he saw was only something in his own eyes.
Rostóv's eyes kept closing.
In Rostóv's fancy appeared the Emperor.
In Rostóv's fancy appeared Denísov.
In Rostóv's fancy appeared Moscow memories.
Rostóv again hurriedly opened his eyes.
Rostóv saw close before him the head and ears of the horse he was riding.
When Rostóv came within six paces of the horse, Rostóv saw the black figures of hussars.
In the distance was still the same misty darkness.
Rostóv thought that the Emperor might meet him and give him an order.
Rostóv thought that the Emperor would say: 'Go and find out what’s there.'
Rostóv thought that there are many stories of the Emperor getting to know an officer in such a chance way and attaching him to himself.
Rostóv thought that if the Emperor gave him a place near him, he would guard the Emperor.
Rostóv thought that he would tell the Emperor the truth.
Rostóv thought that he would unmask the Emperor's deceivers.
Rostóv pictured an enemy or a deceitful German.
Rostóv pictured that he would kill the enemy with pleasure.
Rostóv pictured that he would slap the enemy in the face before the Emperor.
A distant shout aroused Rostóv.
Rostóv started.
Rostóv opened his eyes.
